title.bibl: Russkii Viestnik i Rassviet, May 15, 1926. Consolidation of Two Papers

notesStmt.note: Transcribed from digital images contributed to the Internet Archive by the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

sourceDesc.bibl: Chicago Foreign Language Press Survey, 1936-1941, Works Projects Administration, Chicago Public Library Omnibus Project

revisionDesc.change: Initial TEI transcription from PanGeo Partners, Inc.

div.bibl: Russkii Viestnik i Rassviet (Russian Daily Herald and Rassviet), May 15, 1926. CONSOLIDATION OF TWO PAPERS

body.p: "In the interest of the subscribers and advertisers a consolidation has been brought about between the Russian Daily Herald of Chicago and the Rassviet of New York.

"This consolidation will make this paper the largest Russian daily in America. It is the belief of the management that it will result in greatly increasing circulation, better news facilities, and a broader field generally. It will result in a substantial benefit to both readers and advertisers."
